Reviews.Title: “Could be much better”
Reviews.Author: phread45
Reviews.Content: I understand when you stay in an extended stay motel to not expect a worldclass hotel, but this place could be much better. Check in was real easy and the front desk people were great.That being said the room was something out of an old motel 6. Beds were shoved as close to the door as possible to allow room for fridge and cooktop. Cracks in walls throughout and just an overall not clean feel and smell to the place. 2 queen bed room with only 1 chair in the place. Closet door were removed and old wire shelves put up around the room helped and tio the cheap feel. Won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal For The Money”
Reviews.Author: step12dude
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and painless. Rooms are basic, functional, and clean. My room was a one bedroom studio with a large bed, fully equipped kitchen with stove (no regular oven), microwave, and refrigerator, with a large breakfast bar that also doubled as a work desk. The only issue I encountered is that there as a mild, funky smell when I entered the room - smelled a bit like spoiled milk. I checked but could not find a source for the smell, but since I was only going to be there one night, it didn't matter. Looking at some of the other recent reviews, I didn't encounter any of the issues that others have reported. I did not use the wireless internet service (there is an extra charge for it), since I bring my own mobile wi-fi hotspot. Hotel is convenient to I-17. Note - If you book this hotel, be sure to check out the brand's website, as various discounts (AAA, senior, weekend specials) are available. If you're a first time visitor to the website, you can sometimes snag an additional $10 off the quoted rates.

Reviews.Title: “smelly & dirty”
Reviews.Author: RoadrunnersNewMexico
Reviews.Content: I booked a non-smoking suite SEVEN weeks in advance, yet they had none when we checked in. They had no other rooms and this was close to our meeting, so we had to stay in this smelly cave. The management refused our request for a refund for our inconvenience. They had a take it or leave it attitude. The clerk said just because we reserved a non-smoking room didn't guarantee that we would actually get one. What??? Then why offer non-smoking rooms? The bathroom floor was sticky and dirt was in the corners. There was no lock mechanism in the bathroom door, just door knobs. Blue nail polish was splattered on the bathroom wall and waste basket. The kitchen had one skillet to cook in -- no sauce pans. The upholstered chairs were frayed down to the stuffing, and the carpet was dirty. Don't stay here or any other brand that this corporation owns.

Reviews.Title: “For your safety, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: amberlyn92
Reviews.Content: Me and three relatives were going to stay here as I had a business meeting on the weekend. There were drunk guys hanging outside the rooms, women that looked like "working girls." One ine room the first thing we saw was a bug crawling across the bed! In the other room we rented the bathroom door was taped up as it was falling apart. I asked for non-smoking but the entire room was baked in cigarette smell! It smells like mildew right outside the front desk. There is no seperation between the toilet and the shower. This place was horrible, beyond belief. SAVE YOUR MONEY! THE ROOMS MAY BE CHEAP BUT THEY ARE HORRIBLE AND INCREDIBLY DISGUSTING!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: apd1975
Reviews.Content: key never worked, would have to get it re-keyed daily. Shower drain did not work. This place is not quiet. Had drug deals going on throughout the night in the parking lot as well as trailer trash as quests coming in throughtout the middle of the night. Unless you are use to living in the qhetto i would not recommend this place. My colleague who also was staying here experienced upon checking in having to go thru 3 rooms until one was found that was not dirty. First room the key didnt work (sound familar) then when he was able to access the room the bed wasnt made and the room was dirty. The second room he was given looked like a cancun party had been there with a razor blade left on the nightstand. The third room next to the office looked like the employees used the restroom in it frequently without cleaning it. It was missing a shower curtain, coffe maker and bed pillows. In other words stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rbalaji_it
Reviews.Content: This is a silent and nice place. The cost was also not high. You have the best buy and a shopping mall next to this hotel.so it is a nice time pass in the night

Reviews.Title: “If you can't afford anything better, this will do.”
Reviews.Author: Chisnik
Reviews.Content: Really downmarket. "Studio suite" really . The decor is, well, you really can't apply the word "decor" to the room, especially the bathroom, which is the barest I've seen. No swimming pool, which is exceedingly rare in the Phoenix area. On the other hand, considering that you get a room with a kitchen, in a decent area of town, and the price is as low as it is, it's hard to complain too much. You get what you pay for, and in this place, you're not paying very much.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: bozhawg
Reviews.Content: I didn`t expect much, and that is what i got. At first it don`t look to bad, but that changes. It`s more of a long stay hotel than a regular hotel. People sitting outside their doors at night. I seen the police there a couple of times in a week, not sure what for. When paying for a week at a time the rooms only get cleaned once a week. But you can get clean towels anytime from the front desk, or so they said. It did have a full fridge, a two burner stove and a microwave. Wiifii was $ 5.00 for the lenght of the week. The TV was around a 26" , But not a lot of channels. I`m not sure i would recommend this to anyone, Unless that is all they could afford. $ 212.00 for a week.

Reviews.Title: “COMPLETELY AMAZED”
Reviews.Author: strawberryaz
Reviews.Content: Being familiar with Phoenix, thought because of location & price this would be a downgraded area. We were shocked checking in. The desk peopler were very friendly making telephone reservations & the welcome we got upon arriving was very outgoing, (THE WAY EVERY BUSINESS SHOULD BE) We felt truly appreciated. Unbelieving, when we drove in, very pretty site, grounds very nice, clean & well kept (didn't see a gum wrapper). Above all we got to the room opened the door & what a surprise. Cozy & clean, TV, kitchen area with large bar and stools, large refr. full stove, Microwave, coffeepot, cabinet area stocked with with dishes and cookware, cabinet drawers stocked with utensils for eating & cooking. Very large bathroom. Could live there and be very comfortable. We will be making this our place to stay when going to the valley. Much cheaper then taking our 5th wheel, I realize this read as a paid advertisement & believe me if I read it, I would also think so. However, I do a sure you we are an ordinary senior could who live in the mountain area of Arizona and go to Phoenix often for shopping. We have stayed at numerous places in Phoenix at higher prices and does not have the amenities this room included. SANDI in Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Strange smell”
Reviews.Author: seadaughter
Reviews.Content: It is a budget hotel and it definitely feels like one. It is a hotel with outdoor corridor with people just hang out by their doors. The room seems dated but reasonably clean. There is a very strong, bothersome ammonia smell, however. I cannot put my finger on what might be wrong with the hotel but I would say it is at best an ok stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terri”
Reviews.Author: kitAz
Reviews.Content: It was very awful! Not clean. The sheets were dirty, pillow smells, and restroom very dirty. Didn't stay more than an hour. I lost my money and checked in at sheraton four star by metro mall, for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: UrbanManUSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night, arrived late into Phoenix, left at 8am the next morning. We wanted to be in north Phoenix, as we were heading to the Grand Canyon the next morning, and did not want to get stuck in bad central Phoenix traffic. It was a good 25% cheaper than anything else I could find nearby. The neighborhood was quiet, we felt safe. The room was very small. Can’t use a more flattering word than adequate. Bed was comfortable, climate control worked fine, got some decent shut eye. Room décor was passable. Chair in room was clean, but stained and a bit beat up. Sink in bathroom drained very slowly, as if it was 75% clogged, and sink area was a bit beat up. Television was small. Towels were rough on the skin. For this short stay, the hotel worked, but just barely. I could see it not working for the more fussy in the world. The room definitely looked worse in the light of day, versus the night before when I was dead tired. My overall rating: 5.5 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this property”
Reviews.Author: FindTheBeachNow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is filthy. When I checked in there was a woman dressed in a tube top and short, shorts. She was paying for "another night" in cash (all 20's), I think she was a local "street entrpreneur" because they told her she would need to check out the next day unless she can pay again by 11am. She said she would get more cash tonight so it wouldn't be a problem. This should have been a sign. The room was very dirty at first inspection. Upon closer inspection I found cockroaches and signs of rodents. It looks fine enough from the outside and seems to be in an ok area, the rooms have a kitchen but overall the room is very small - they are microtel of suites. This property is very dirty, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bummed at Homestead”
Reviews.Author: cdelacey777
Reviews.Content: The hotel was first of all very very dirty, it has great ammenities such as a kitchen with microwave and stovetop and large frige, but the cabinets were coated with grease that got on my clothes when I leaned on them and someone had not cleaned around the toilet or tub in the bathroom for many weeks, it appeared. As I got there on a weekend, there was no one to come and clean it up and the manager said I could change rooms, but they were all in the same state of uncleaniness. Sufice it to say that there were very numerous pubic hairs and instances of wiped nasal discharges on the walls, tubs, counters, etc. This could be a very nice place to stay for a while if anyone ever cleaned it. I had to get clean sheets as they had not been changed either. The people working there were very nice and helpful, but no help should have been needed. There was also mold all over the bathroom in abundance. I had to go out and buy clorox clean-up to kill it. It was also advertised on-line to have a 27" TV and it only had a 19" TV, and of course nothing could be done about that. I stayed there 2 weeks because my company put me there and I spent two days cleaning the place up. The housekeeping person came and scraped some of the grease off the counter with a credit card as he had no chisel. I had to do the rest as I gathered housekeeping had no clue about how to clean. There is just no excuse for a place being that ill taken care of.

HotelInfo.Name: Homestead Phoenix Metro
HotelInfo.Address: 2102 West Dunlap Avenue, Phoenix, AZ 85021
